Description: Woods and thickets in hills and low mountains all over Japan[58]. Sunny meadows from the lowlands to elevations of 1500 metres in Japan[275].

Clinopodium chinense is a PERENNIAL growing to 0.5 m (1ft 8in).  See above for USDA hardiness. It is hardy to UK zone 7.  It is in flower from August to September, and the seeds ripen from September to October. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs) and is pollinated by Bees, insects.  Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils and prefers  well-drained soil. Suitable pH: mildly acid, neutral and basic (mildly alkaline) soils. It can grow in  semi-shade (light woodland) or no shade. It prefers  moist soil.
Woodland Garden Dappled Shade; Shady Edge;
Tea: the various herb teas that can be used in place of tea, plus the genuine article.
Young leaves - cooked[105, 177]. A sweet and aromatic herb tea is made from the leaves[200].

Succeeds in almost any well-drained soil[1]. A polymorphic species[58]. Plants are best grown in a rock garden[1].

Seed - sow spring in a cold frame. Only just cover the seed. Germination usually takes place within 2 weeks at 21°c. When large enough to handle, prick the seedlings out into individual pots and grow them on in the greenhouse. Plant them out in the summer if they have made sufficient growth, otherwise plant them out in late spring or early summer of the following year. Division in spring. Larger clumps can be replanted direct into their permanent positions, though it is best to pot up smaller clumps and grow them on in a cold frame until they are rooting well. Plant them out in the summer or following spring. Cuttings of soft wood in May or June.
